:: title: Multi-Return Test Script
:: version: 1.0

# Define a function that returns multiple values
func multiReturnFunc() returns val1, val2, val3 means
    emit "Inside multiReturnFunc"
    set val1 = 100
    set val2 = "Success"
    set val3 = true
    return val1, val2, val3
endfunc

# Main procedure to call the multi-return function
func main() returns resultList means
    emit "Calling multiReturnFunc..."
    # Call the function and assign the result (which will be a list)
    set resultList = multiReturnFunc()
    emit "Call complete. Result list:", resultList

    # Optionally, check individual elements
    must resultList[0] == 100
    must resultList[1] == "Success"
    must resultList[2] == true

    emit "Checks passed."
    # The list itself is returned by main implicitly if needed,
    # or explicitly via 'return resultList'
    return resultList
endfunc

func errorCase() means
    # This will fail at runtime because set doesn't support multi-assignment yet
    # set x, y = multiReturnFunc()
    emit "This shouldn't run in current implementation."
endfunc
